text: According to Karl Max, socialism developed as a consequence of the evils of ________
explanation: According to Karl Marx, socialism developed as a consequence of the evils ofcapitalism. Marx argued that socialism was a response to the inequalities and exploitation inherent in capitalist systems.

explanation: The United States Congress is the Bicameral legislature of the federal government of the United States, and consists of two chambers: the House of Representatives and the Senate.

text: Which of the following agents can be considered as the most effective agent of political socialisation? The _______
explanation:
The following agents of Socialization influence to different degrees an individual's political opinions:

text: A corrupt judicial system erodes the observance of _______
explanation: A corrupt judicial system erodes the observance of the rule of law. When the judiciary is corrupt, it undermines the fairness and integrity of legal processes and the rule of law itself.

text: The body responsible for the implementation of law is the _____
explanation: “Executive Government” broadly refers to the arm of government responsible for carrying out or administering laws enacted by the legislature.

text: In a constitutional monarchy, the king or queen is referred to as
explanation: A constitutional monarchy is a form of government in which a non-elected monarch functions as the head of state within the limits of a constitution. The monarch may be the de facto head of state or a purely ceremonial leader.

text: Military intervention into the politics of a state involves ______

options.A: an overthrow of a legitimate government by pressure groups
options.B: the seizure of power from a legitimate government by the armed forces
options.C: violent overthrow of a democratic government by the police
options.D: the legitimate seizure of power by the police and civilians

explanation: A military government is generally any government that is administrated by military forces, whether this government is legal or not under the laws of the jurisdiction at issue, and whether this government is formed by natives or by an occupying power.

text: Local government are vital in modern politics as they ________

options.B: train the local people in the art of governance
options.C: make laws for the whole country
options.D: execute government policies at all levels

explanation: Local government can play an important role in promoting  training people for governance, job creation and boosting the local economy. By providing good quality cost-effective services and by making the local area a pleasant place to live and work in the municipality will have made a good start to sustainable local economic development.

text: Which of the following is a civil/public servant?
explanation: Acivil servantorpublic servantis a person employed in thepublicsector on behalf of a government department or agency. Acivil servantorpublic servant'sfirst priority is to represent the interests of citizens.

text: In a military regime, the arms of government that are usually fused are _________
explanation: In a military regime, the arms of government that are usually fused arelegislature and executive. The military often consolidates power in such regimes, combining legislative and executive functions under a single authority.

text: A constitution is considered to be flexible if it _______?

options.A: can be amended by a simple majority
options.B: can be altered through special procedure

explanation: A flexible constitution is a constitution that may be amended by the ordinary process of legislation and is therefore relatively easy to amend.

text: The principle of checks and balances is important because it

options.A: prevents each organ of government from being dictatorial
options.B: frees other organs from judicial control
options.D: makes the government to perform it civic responsibilities

explanation: The system of checks and balances is an important part of the Constitution. With checks and balances, each of the three branches of government can limit the powers of the others. Each branch “checks” the power of the other branches to make sure that the power is balanced between them.

text: Which of the following is a fundamental right? Right to
explanation: Theright to lifeis a moral principle based on the belief that a human being has therightto live and, in particular, should not be killed by another entity including government.

text: Government maintains law and order through the following except ________?
explanation: Government maintains law and order through the following except the legislature. While the legislature is responsible for making laws, the enforcement and maintenance of law and order are primarily carried out by the police, immigration authorities and prison services.

text: A corrupt judicial system erodes the observance of ______?
explanation: Rule of law is the principle that all people and institutions are subject to and accountable tolawthat is fairly applied and enforced. A corrupt judicial system will undermine the principle of rule of law and act superior

explanation: Legitimacy is the right and acceptance of an authority, usually a governing law or a régime.

text: Which of the following countries practiced totalitarianism?
explanation: The countries that practised totalitarianism include Italy, Russia, and Germany. These countries were known for their totalitarian regimes during the 20th century, with Mussolini's Italy, Stalin's Soviet Union, and Hitler's Germany being prominent examples.

text: A function of government is _________
explanation: Major functionsof modern governmentinclude(1) foreign diplomacy(2) making laws(3) maintenance of domestic order(4) administration of justice(5) protection of civil liberties(6) provision for and regulation of the conduct of periodic elections(7) provision for public goods and services(8) military defense

text: The excessive power of the traditional rulers in the pre-colonial era could checked by ________
explanation: The excessive power of the traditional rulers in the pre-colonial era could be checked by the priests. In many pre-colonial societies, priests had significant influence and could act as a counterbalance to the power of traditional rulers.

text: The post-Second World War Nationalism in West Africa was characterised by
explanation: The post-Second World War nationalism in West Africa was characterised byincreased agitation. This period saw heightened demands for independence and self-governance across the region.

text: The rights of citizens to benefit from public utility is classified as
explanation: Social rights:the rights to an adequate standard of living, adequate housing, and food; the right to the highest attainable standard of health; the rights to education and social security.

text: Which of the following strengthen the power of the Supreme Court against the executive and the legislature?
explanation: Judicial review is a process under which executive, legislative and administrative actions are subject to review by the judiciary.

text: Policy of assimilation was successfully operated by the French in
explanation: Thepolicy of assimilationwas a French colonial policy aimed at integrating African colonies into French culture and administration, treating them as extensions of France rather than separate territories. This policy was most successfully implemented in theFour Communes of Senegal:Gorée, Saint-Louis, Dakar, and Rufisque.

text: The theory of separation of powers was propounded by ________
explanation: This doctrine signifies the fact that one person or body of persons should not exercise all the three powers of the government. The theory of Doctrine of Separation of Power was first propounded by Montesquieu, a French scholar in and 1747 published in his book 'Espirit des Louis' (The spirit of the laws).

explanation: Government is the group of people with the authority to govern a country or state

text: Which system of government has fusion of ceremonial and executive functions as a feature ________
explanation: A presidential system is a democratic and republican system of government where a head of government leads an executive branch that is separate from the legislative branch. This head of government is in most cases also the head of state, which is called president.

text: An agreed set of regulations, conventions and customs by which a country or an organisation is governed is the ________
explanation: A constitution is an aggregate of fundamental principles or established precedents that constitute the legal basis of a polity, organisation or other type of entity, and commonly determine how that entity is to be governed.

text: A system of government which is based on public ownership of means of production and distribution is called
explanation: A system of government which is based on public ownership of means of production and distribution is calledsocialism.

text: In the pre-colonial era, the breaking of an oath by a chief could _________

options.A: lead to a war with his neighbours
options.C: make his state come under a curse

explanation: In the pre-colonial era, the breaking of an oath by a chief could lead to his destoolment. This means that the chief could be stripped of his power, authority or status as a consequence of breaking an oath.

text: Which of the following is not a feature of a state?
explanation: While mass media is important for communication and information dissemination within a state, it is not considered a fundamental feature that defines a state. The essential features of a state includesovereignty,governmentterritoryand apopulation. These are the core elements that establish the existence and functioning of a state. Mass media, on the other hand, is a tool that can be used by the state but is not a defining characteristic of one.

text: One feature of pre-independence constitutions in West Africa is the
explanation: Pre-independence constitutions in West Africa often established these two key bodies to manage the colonial administration. TheExecutive Counciltypically consisted of colonial officials and was responsible for implementing policies, while theLegislative Councilincluded both colonial officials and a limited number of African representatives and was tasked with making laws.

text: The guiding principle of communism is from each according to his/her

options.A: ability and to each according to his/her need'
options.B: qualification and to each according to his/her need'
options.C: race and to each according to his/her ability'
options.D: age and to each according to his/ her status

explanation: This principle is central to communist ideology, which advocates for a classless society where resources and wealth are distributed based on individual needs rather than their contribution or status. The phrase means that everyone should contribute to society according to their abilities, and in return, they should receive what they need to live a fulfilling life. This approach contrasts with capitalist principles, which often reward individuals based on their ability to acquire wealth or status.

text: The political party whose membership comprises people of high social status is called
explanation: This type of political party primarily consists of members from the higher social strata, such as wealthy individuals, intellectuals or people with significant influence in society. These parties tend to focus on the interests and perspectives of the elite class and represent their specific concerns and ideologies in the political arena.

text: For democracy to be sustained in a country it needs a
explanation: For democracy to be sustained, the electorate must be knowledgeable about political issues, candidates and the functioning of the government. An informed electorate can make wise decisions during elections and ensure that the democratic process remains strong and effective. Without a well-informed electorate, democracy may be vulnerable to manipulation and the influence of corrupt leaders.

text: The electoral system in which the winner should have more than all the votes of all the other contestants put together is called
explanation: In this electoral system, a candidate must secure more votes than the combined total of all other candidates' votes to be declared the winner. This means the winner needs to obtain over 50% of the total votes cast. This system is more demanding than a simple majority, as it requires a more definitive level of support from the electorate.

text: Colonial administration in West Africa was a result of

options.A: a need for a new environment
options.B: the desire to underdevelop West Africa
options.C: a need for raw materials and markets
options.D: the urge to introduce western education

explanation: Thepurpose of colonisationwas to serve as a source of inexpensive labour and natural resources.  Most colonists had faced difficult lives in Britain, Ireland, Scotland or Germany. They came to Africa to escape poverty, warfare, political turmoil, famine and disease. They believed colonial life offered new opportunities.

text: The Secretary of State for the colonies was responsible for

options.C: fighting for the interest of the people

explanation: He was responsible for the administration of the colonies. One of the functions of the Secretary of State was to advise the British Crown on persons who could be appointed as Governors for the British colonies.

text: A political party is significant because it _____?
explanation: The presence of thepolitical partyis actually a healthy situation for the nation. It gives the people a choice to make a more evolved and effective decision.

text: One primary objective of the New Partnership for African Development (NEPAD) is to
explanation: The New Partnership for Africa's Development (NEPAD) is a socio-economic flagship Programme of the African Union (AU). NEPAD's four primary objectives are to eradicate poverty, promote sustainable growth and development, integrate Africa in the world economy and accelerate the empowerment of women.

text: The crown colonies in the British West Africa were administered through _________
explanation: Directcolonialruleis a form of colonialism that involves the establishment of a centralized foreign authority within a territory, which is run by colonial officials.

text: One duty of a good citizen is __________

options.B: respect of the dignity and rights of others

explanation: Respect and obey federal, state, and local laws.Respect the rights, beliefs, and opinions of others.Pay income and other taxes honestly, and on time, to federal, state, and local authorities.Defend the country if the need should arise.

text: One of the defects associated with most pre-independence constitutions in British West Africa was ________

options.C: African domination of the executive council
options.D: African domination of the legislative council

explanation: One of the significant defects of most pre-independence constitutions in British West Africa was the veto power held by the colonial governors. These governors, appointed by the British Crown, had the authority to override decisions made by the legislative councils, which limited the political influence and autonomy of African leaders and representatives. This power effectively kept real control in the hands of the colonial authorities.

text: An effective way of strengthening societal institutions is through the expression of ____________
explanation: Public opinion consists of the desires, wants and thinking of the majority of the people. It is the collective opinion of the people of a society or state on an issue or problem. This concept came about through the process of urbanization and other political and social forces.

text: A "Yes" or No" vote on a specific political issue in a country is called ________
explanation: A referendum is a direct vote in which an entire electorate is invited to vote on a particular proposal. This may result in the adoption of a new law. In some countries, it is synonymous with a plebiscite or a vote on a ballot question. It could be a ''yes or no''

text: Bicameralism is necessary in a federal state to demonstrate that __________

options.C: representation in the upper house is base on population
options.D: representation of the rich in society is taken care of

explanation: In certain variations, a bicameral system may include two parliamentary chambers. The overall purpose behind bicameral legislature is to provide for representation for both the citizens of a country, as well as the state legislatures on the federal level or in the central government of a country or nation.

text: The Economic Community of West African States (ECOWAS) was formally established in Lagos on _________
explanation: The ECOWAS Treaty (also known as the Treaty of Lagos)established the community when it was signed in Lagos, Nigeria, on May 28, 1975.

text: A political system in which there is only one legalized political party is called a ________
explanation: A one-party state, single-party state, one-party system, or single-party system is a type of state in which one political party has the right to form the government, usually based on the existing constitution.
